abstract: The Federal Trade Commission announced a multinational push against schemes that deceive owners into allowing access to their PCs.
snippet: The Federal Trade Commission announced a multinational push against schemes that deceive owners into allowing access to their PCs.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Consumer frauds often make claims that are too good to be true. But a recent one, cited by regulators around the world Wednesday, depended on a pitch that many people found completely believable — that Microsoft or another computer company knows what is on your personal computer.

headline.main: Multinational Crackdown on Computer Con Artists
headline.print_headline: F.T.C. Crackdown Aims At Tech Support Fraud
